duck: USS Volans (AKS-9) - USS Volans was an Acubens-class general stores issue ship commissioned by the U.S. Navy for service in World War II. She was responsible for delivering and disbursing goods and equipment to ...
Volans is a constellation in the southern sky.
A constellation in the polar region of the celestial Southern Hemisphere near Carina and Dorado.

Chamaeleon | latmax = 15 | latmin = 90 | month = March | notes=}} 'Volans' is a constellation in the southern sky. It represents a flying fish; its name is a shortened form of its original name, 'Piscis Volans'. Volans was one of twelve constellations created by Petrus Plancius from the observations of Pieter Dirkszoon Keyser and Frederick de Houtman and it first appeared on a 35-cm diameter celestial globe published in 1597 (or 1598) in Amsterdam by Plancius with Jodocus Hondius. The first depiction of this constellation in a celestial atlas was in Johann Bayer's [[Uranometria]] of 1603.
